content:
That's a wonderful takeaway! Trusting your instincts and being present in the moment is crucial for any actor. It's easy to get caught up in overthinking and self-doubt, but when you let go of that, you can tap into a deeper level of creativity and authenticity.

It's great that your instructor emphasized the importance of responding truthfully to your scene partners. When you focus on listening and reacting honestly, it creates a more authentic and engaging performance. It's almost like you're having a real conversation, rather than just reciting lines.

By letting go of self-doubt and trusting your instincts, you open yourself up to new possibilities and opportunities for growth. It's amazing how much more freedom and creativity you can experience when you're not bogged down by overthinking.

How did you find that this new mindset affected your performances during the workshop? Did you notice a difference in how you felt or how your scenes played out?

Also, have you been able to apply this mindset to other areas of your life, outside of acting?
